analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the Paṭṭhāna text with the Tikas

original: 23.26. Dassanattika, Kusalattika🔽Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: dassana ttika kusala ttika  na dassanena pahātabbam na kusalam dhammam paccayā na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The section on the visible, the section on the wholesome🔽With an unwholesome state that is to be abandoned by vision as condition, a wholesome state that is neither to be abandoned by vision nor by development comes to be. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, three. … With the unformed element as condition, three.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam na akusalam dhammam paccayā dassanena pahātabbaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With an unwholesome state that is to be abandoned by vision as condition, a wholesome state that is to be abandoned by vision comes to be. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, six. … With the unformed element as condition, six.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ
translated: With an indeterminate state that is to be abandoned by vision as condition, an indeterminate state that is to be abandoned by vision …

original: abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With an indeterminate state that is to be abandoned by vision as condition, an indeterminate state that is to be abandoned by development comes to be. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, six. With predominance as condition, six. … With the unformed element as condition, six.
